title: Spatiotemporal Data Analysis Project for Landslide Prediction

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment understanding basic principles of landslide prediction models and analyzing real-world cases through data analysis practice using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can analyze landslide risk factors by integrating spatial data (e.g., satellite imagery) with environmental data over time.
Learners can explain the basic architecture of a deep learning model (CAE-RNN) and its application to spatiotemporal pattern recognition.
Learners can evaluate landslide prediction results using quantitative metrics such as precision, recall, and F1-score.

resources: Google Earth Engine or QGIS Educational Licenses
TensorFlow/Keras-Based Simple Deep Learning Lab Environment
Landslide Case Study Reports (Provided by Education Office)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
